comment: Very good. The examples in his lectures are extremely similar to the questions on his mid-terms. If you master the examples' concepts, then you'll be fine; He won't try to fool you. It requires a lot of studying, but the way I looked at it is, if I can't do well on these mid-terms, then how the heck am I gonna pass the CPA exam.

Loved Professor Chambers! The class itself is hard, but he does a great job explaining everything. Hes chill but youve GOT to study to pass. The material is difficult and it comes at you fast. Take this mans class!

Dr. Chambers is knowledgeable and enthusiastic, but this is a hard class. HW is much more in depth than in class. Tests are 15 questions only - no room for error. Pros: HW, LearnSmart, and quizzes are a good cushion and he grades on a curve. Cons: Very hard, very challenging. Great professor, though; He knows his stuff.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr Chambers was a pretty good professor. He was pretty knowledgeable about the content and did a good job explaining it for the most part. Only complaints are the tests and HW problems. HW problems are much harder than quizzes/exercises/etc and the tests were incredibly short (15 MCQs) meaning little room for error. The class is graded on a curve.

Introduces the class as comparable to "unrelenting and drinking from a FIRE hose!" He isn't kidding. Toughest professor I have every had. Most homework problems are hardest possible (takes hours), 15 question multiple choice exams Takes attendance . Uses his own grading scale, he says an 83 and above is an A but 83 is freaking hard to get!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: 10 question tests. Multiple choice. Very difficult to get a good grade.  Timing of when homework is due is poor. Barely have time to learn before it's due But very knowledable and willing to help.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Chambers explains the material as clearly as possible. This is a senior level accounting course. Attendance is mandatory. No partial credit on exams. They're multiple choice, half conceptual, half problems. He's there to help if you schedule time to meet with him and he's enthusiastic about it. Extra credit is available, but not a lot.

He is very organized and interested in making you learn and understand the material. This class is hard, but if you keep with the homework and put in a good amount of study time you will do fine. Got a B taking it in summer one

Professor Chambers is a great professor! Do the homework each week even though you can drop one because it helps reinforce concepts. This class requires a good bit of outside studying but that is because of the material. I recommend taking him for this course because he is passionate and helpful!

You will learn so much from Professor Chambers, but you must put in some effort. If you want an easy A, don't take him. Homework, in class exercises & quizzes help prepare you for tests. Tests are multiple choice. Final grades are curved A LOT! Overall, Chambers is one of the better accounting professors I've taken at KSU.

This class is extremely hard and needs a teacher who is willing to break it down to a easy to understand level.  Dr. Chambers is not that person.  He makes his test tricky on purpose in order to get you thinking in a different way but if that is his objective then he should teach the material in a different way.

Best Professor, there is a lot of material and the class in nature is not easy, but Professor Chambers makes you use your brain, he is very organized, always available for students and very good at explaining the material,now if you are lazy and don't like to spend some time studying, this class is not for you and acct in general is not for you...
He is the worst professor I ever had!!! He is only a teacher because he is lazy and doesn't want to work a lot. I am an all A student in accounting and I received a C from him. Jerk!

Take Chambers, you will learn a lot.  I would put his tests at about an 8 (out of 10) on a hardness scale, but he grades fairly and communicates the material well.  8 quizzes and online homework assignments; he drops the lowest 2 of each.  1 group project.  12% curve.

He was, like most I've had in the accounting department, a great professor.  His tests were super hard and stressful but scaled.  Suggestions: Don't take during Maymester (too much material) and pay attention in 3100.  His tests combine what you're supposed to know from 3100 and the new material.  He is a great professor.
This is a hard class. My advice is to be in class, read the book and for test work all quiz questions and homework over and over again. Over all I learned a lot and became a more disciplined.

This class consists of 2 very difficult tests and a final, 8 hw assignments, 8 quizzes, and a group project. He drops the lowest 2 quizzes and hw assignments. He curves the final grade. Even though the class is hard, I suggest you take him. You will learn a lot.
